data.title: TOMORROW: Bennet Continues CO Innovation Tour at Newton Running Company
data.meta_description:
Media Advisory


Boulder, CO – TOMORROW, Tuesday, April 22, 2014 at 10:05 AM MST, Colorado U.S. Senator Michael Bennet continues his statewide CO Innovation Tour with a visit to the Newton Running Company’s Running Lab. Newton Running Company makes cutting-edge running shoes. The innovative firm holds several  patents, including its Action/Reaction technology, which encourages a more natural running gait and enhances shock absorbency and energy return.


Bennet’s visit to Newton Running Company is one in a series  he is making throughout the state this week and last to highlight Colorado’s inventive and entrepreneurial spirit.  The tour is in advance of this summer’s opening of a U.S. Patent and Trademark satellite office in Denver, which will benefit Colorado’s innovation economy through an improved and more accessible patent process. Bennet coordinated the state’s effort to bring a satellite patent office to Colorado.


WHO: U.S. Senator Michael Bennet


WHAT: Highlighting Colorado’s Innovation Economy with Visit to Newton Running Company’s Running Lab


WHERE: Newton Running Lab, 1300 Walnut Street, Boulder, CO 80302


WHEN: TOMORROW, Tuesday, April 22, 2014 at 10:05 AM MST


###

Bennet’s visit to Newton Running Company is one in a series he is making throughout the state this week and last to highlight Colorado’s inventive and entrepreneurial spirit. The tour is in advance of this summer’s opening of a U.S. Patent and Trademark satellite office in Denver, which will benefit Colorado’s innovation economy through an improved and more accessible patent process. Bennet coordinated the state’s effort to bring a satellite patent office to Colorado.
